text: Colonel Bertram Stuart Trevelyan Archer GC OBE ERD (3 February 1915 â€“ 2 May 2015), known as Stuart Archer, was a recipient of the George Cross, the highest British and Commonwealth award for gallantry not in the face of the enemy. Archer was born in London. On 3 February 2015 Archer became the first recipient of the Victoria Cross or the George Cross to reach 100 years of age. Archer died on 2 May 2015 at the age of 100. ==References== Category:1915 births Category:2015 deaths Category:British centenarians Category:British military personnel of World War II Category:People from Hampstead
